about_the_game:
The Ferrovia Appennino Centrale, or Central Apennine Railway, was a narrow gauge railway in Italy. The entire route as it existed in 1899 has been carefully reconstructed in Trainz using custom made assets ONLY (vegetation and textures being the only exceptions).

The railway connected Arezzo, a city in Tuscany on the Florence to Rome railway, to Fossato di Vico, a village in Umbria on the Rome to Ancona railway. The "trenino" crossed beautiful mountains and valleys and called at medieval cities like Anghiari and Sansepolcro in Tuscany, and Città di Castello, Umbertide and Gubbio in Umbria. It was constructed in 1886 and was of great importance to the development of the region. It got heavily damaged during the Second World War and was, with the exception of the section between Umbertide and Sansepolcro, never rebuilt.

Main characteristics:

- About 160 custom made assets

- Included rolling stock: 1 Couillet 0-6-0T steam locomotive, 2 passenger carriages and 4 cargo wagons.

- Length: 133 km / 83 miles

- Maximum speed: about 35 km/h / 22 mph

- Travel time: about 5.5 hours

- Number of stations: 32

- Track gauge: 950mm / 3 1/8 feet

- Maximum climb: 3%

Enjoy the landscape and history of this beautiful part of Italy!

The Ferrovia Appennino Centrale, or Central Apennine Railway, was a narrow gauge railway in Italy. The entire route as it existed in 1899 has been carefully reconstructed in Trainz using custom made assets ONLY (vegetation and textures being the only exceptions).

The railway connected Arezzo, a city in Tuscany on the Florence to Rome railway, to Fossato di Vico, a village in Umbria on the Rome to Ancona railway. The "trenino" crossed beautiful mountains and valleys and called at medieval cities like Anghiari and Sansepolcro in Tuscany, and Città di Castello, Umbertide and Gubbio in Umbria. It was constructed in 1886 and was of great importance to the development of the region. It got heavily damaged during the Second World War and was, with the exception of the section between Umbertide and Sansepolcro, never rebuilt.

Main characteristics:

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 11.6
  • Processor: Intel i5 2Ghz
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Radeon Pro 555 with 1GB VRAM supporting OpenGL 3.3
  • Storage: 900 MB available space

  • Processor: Intel i5 3GHz 64Bit Processor
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GT 430 or better/ AMD ATI 5550 or better
  • Storage: 900 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Yes

short_description: Drive through the Italian countryside in 1899 with this 133km long 950mm narrow gauge route with steep grades and 32 stations. Featuring a Couillet 0-6-0T steam locomotive, this route will present the challenges faced by pioneering steam locomotive crews!
supported_languages: English, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Czech, Dutch, Polish, Russian
